Discussion Topic

One of your roles is to help caregivers understand how to best support children's healthy development.

Let's look at a situation in which a caregiver has concerns about a child’s development.

Scenario

Troy's Parent: "He's way too intense! Every night bedtime is a 2-hour battle. He's always so excited to go on family outings, but then he ruins them; he runs around, then has a tantrum when we try to get him to settle down."

Rating Activity

According to the description of Troy, rate Troy as High or Low on the following temperament characteristics.

  • Activity: Able to sit still vs. Always wants to move (high)
  • Rhythmicity: Accepts schedule for food and sleep vs. Is unpredictable (high)
  • Approach/Withdrawal: Dives into situations vs. Is shy and cautious (low)
  • Intensity: Sensitive to textures or settings vs. May not notice when they fall (high)

    • Sample Feedback

    Once parents understand their child's temperament, they are in a better position to understand their child.

    Although this example was an extreme case, keep in mind that characteristics of temperament extend from low to high with many children falling between the two extremes.
